item.title: Network effects: Social media’s role in the London riots — Tech News and Analysis
item.description: Network effects: Social media’s role in the London riots http://dlvr.it/fNGHx
item.content:encoded: Network effects: Social media’s role in the London riots http://dlvr.it/fNGHx Everyone seems to be looking to blame Twitter, Facebook or BlackBerry for the recent London riots, but these tools are just aspects of our increasingly real-time, mobile and connected digital lives -- and that can be an incredibly powerful force for both good and bad. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gigaom.com

item.title: How Your Social Data Will Power Walmart’s E-Commerce Revolution | TechCrunch
item.description: How Your Social Data Will Power Walmart's E-Commerce Revolution http://tcrn.ch/nkqOCO
item.content:encoded: How Your Social Data Will Power Walmart's E-Commerce Revolution http://tcrn.ch/nkqOCO Walmart is planning to launch several new projects this holiday season based on the technology it acquired from the social media startup Kosmix back in April. Kosmix’s platform previously powered multiple services, including a Twitter search site called TweetBeat, a health vertical called RightHealth and a homepage where users could search the Web by topic. But the core of what Kosmix was building was something called the “social genome” – a way to organize the content in social networks in order to connect people with the information that mattered to them. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com
